pkgmetadata.longdescription: Analysis of Omics Data in Observational Studies // A collection of fast and flexible functions for analyzing omics data in observational studies. Multiple different approaches for integrating environmental/genetic factors, omics data, and/or phenotype data are implemented. This includes functions for performing omics wide association studies with one or more variables of interest as the exposure or outcome; a function for performing a meet in the middle analysis for linking exposures, omics, and outcomes (as described by Chadeau-Hyam et al., (2010) doi:10.3109/1354750X.2010.533285); and a function for performing a mixtures analysis across all omics features using quantile-based g-Computation (as described by Keil et al., (2019) doi:10.1289/EHP5838).
